DOC.brief_summary: The Institute International Internet Interventions Health ( i4Health ) Palo Alto University propose develop digital tool specifically design help low income English-speaking Spanish-speaking smoker quit . The investigator aim test whether mobile-based digital intervention design systematic input low-income English- Spanish-speaking smoker public sector health care system significantly improve acceptability , utilization , effectiveness . Using human-centered development method , project involve low-income patient San Francisco Health Network design web app/text message tool . The investigator also use participant input improve recruitment dissemination strategy . i4Health join force Center Behavioral Intervention Technologies ( CBITs ) Northwestern University iteratively develop successive version digital intervention inform human-centered approach . The full study involve 4 successive outcome study test effectiveness Stop Smoking San Francisco web app . The first three single-group non-randomized pre-post study 1 , 2 , 3-month follow-up . These test gradually improve version app . The fourth study involve randomize trial compare initial version ( baseline version ) web app final version web app , determine final version significantly well baseline version term increase utilization abstinence rate . To join study , go : http : //stopsmokingsf.org
DOC.brief_title: Using Technology Help Low-income Latino Smokers Quit
DOC.detailed_description: The project involve three specific aim : Specific Aim # 1 : Human-centered development English/Spanish smoking cessation web app . The investigator develop iterative version digital smoke cessation tool ( web app text message component ) highly responsive need preference low-income English- Spanish-speaking smoker . Development take place systematic input patient part San Francisco Health Network ( SFHN ) . The SFHN serve 70,000 member , low-income individual . Specific Aim # 2 : Improvement dissemination strategy . Input SFHN patient identify effective way reach encouraging low-income English- Spanish-speaking smoker use digital smoking cessation intervention develop . This information support ongoing dissemination implementation effort beyond grant period . Specific Aim # 3 : Evaluation result smoke cessation web app . Researchers evaluate effectiveness successive version result stop smoking web app recruit smoker two level : ) within SFHN , b ) throughout state California , culminate online randomize control trial . Increased effectiveness define 1 ) increase utilization web app 2 ) high abstinence rate obtain baseline `` usual care '' web app .
DOC.criteria: English speaking ( ES ) Spanish speaking ( SS ) Not smoker
